Title: AI/LLM Engineer
Description:
What We Do

READ BEFORE APPLYING: Adding a short intro video is mandatory for this position. We do this to get a better sense of candidates before continuing the process. Any application without a video will be rejected by default. Find instructions at the bottom of the post. No cover letter is required. Thank you!

At Briink, we're helping accelerate the transition to a sustainable future by creating the next-generation of AI powered tools for sustainability advisory, audit, and certification teams.

We believe that AI is the key to unlocking the future of sustainable business. With over 50 enterprise clients—including some of the world's largest firms—we’re already transforming how organizations manage their ESG data. Our technology helps sustainability teams uncover actionable insights from unstructured data sources, making it easier to drive compliance, efficiency, and impact at scale.

Backed by €7 million in capital, including a freshly closed round, and supported by leading venture capital funds, Briink is at the forefront of ESG innovation. We’re based at the heart of Europe’s AI revolution—the AI Campus in Berlin—where we are building a future where AI helps accelerate the transition to a sustainable future.

Your role

As Briink’s AI/LLM Engineer, you will work as part of the product and engineering team to bring the cutting edge of LLMs to sustainable finance and help advance Briink’s mission to use AI to help accelerate transition to a sustainable economy. This includes both using your knowledge and experience as an AI practitioner to evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM engine, as well as explore new use-cases for LLMs in ESG and sustainability.


Systematically evaluate and improve our core LLM systems: You will use your knowledge and experience as an AI/LLM practitioner to systematically evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM system and help ensure Briink becomes a world leader for ESG domain specific LLM tools.
Build LLMs into production grade services: On a scale with pure researcher on one side and traditional backend software development on the other side, this leans somewhat more on the software engineering side of the scale, as part of your role will also be to help ensure that improvements to the AI/LLM services are driven through to production and delivering tangible value to our users.
Explore new LLM use-cases in ESG: Both LLMs are ESG are moving very fast and so at Briink we value curiosity and exploring AI could be applied to new use cases in ESG. Part of your role therefore will be to explore and prototype new ways LLMs could support our users and solve new problems for ESG teams.
Be a core member of the product and engineering team: Briink is a collaborative team and we really enjoy working together to try and build Briink into a successful company that has mission impact at scale. You will therefore work closely as part of a cross discipline team to make sure all the work we do pushes in the same direction an helps achieve our mission.


Your profile

Your Profile


Knowledgable and experienced with building AI/LLM products: You have strong knowledge and experience of thinking through and building AI/LLM systems successfully.
Practical Implementer: You are a ‘builder’ and aim to pragmatically integrate AI into real-world products, moving beyond research to create tangible, impactful solutions.
Personal agency and drive: must have personal agency, drive and ability to figure things out, learn and iterate.
Innovative Thinker: You're driven by curiosity and continually experiment with new technologies and techniques in the rapidly evolving AI/LLM space.
Excellent Communicator: You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English, and can build strong relationships with internal teams and external partners.
Collaborative and Organised: You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve success. Preferably with experience in start-ups.
Passion for ESG and Sustainability: You are motivated by using your skills to help address climate change and enthusiastic about building tools that help ESG and sustainability teams.


Skill Requirements


Minimum of 4 years of experience: As an AI Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, AI/ML Product Engineer or related roles.
Fluency in python: Including strong proficiency with base python as well as popular modern frameworks ****(e.g. fastAPI)
Experience with LLMs: Including core concepts around foundation models, prompt engineering and LLM chains, as well as preferably some experience with LLM frameworks (e.g. Langchain). Experience using LLMs to build RAG systems and/or other real-world use-cases related to document processing would be a major bonus.
Experience with LLM evaluation: Including how to collect labelled data and systematically evaluate RAG and other real world LLM applications, preferably with experience in evaluation tools and frameworks (e.g. Langsmith)
Experience with production grade applications: Including familiarity with software development tools and practices for production applications (e..g git, CI/CD, containerization) and preferably some experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment (e.g. GCP/AWS/Azure, Modal). Any experience with implications of deploying LLMs at scale would be a major bonus.
Fluency in English: With the ability to clearly communicate complex topics to diverse stakeholders.
Understanding or interest in sustainability: Including an interest in sustainability climate, or ESG topics and a desire to use your skills to help accelerate the climate transition.


Even if your experience doesn’t align precisely with all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. Many people miss out on opportunities because they feel they don’t fit every requirement—we believe in growth, not perfection!

What We Offer


Competitive Remuneration: As a core member of our team, you will receive a competitive salary and equity package, reflecting your role in shaping Briink’s future.
Purpose-Driven Mission: ESG data has the power to create a more sustainable world, but today it presents more challenges than solutions. We believe AI can change that. Be part of the transition to an AI-powered, sustainable world.
Flexible Working: Our work philosophy is built on flexibility. While we do like to come to the office (in Berlin or London) to collaborate in person, this is a hybrid role with opportunities for some remote work within European time zones.
Trust and Ownership: At Briink, we empower you to own your projects with the option for growing into new roles. We believe in giving people autonomy and trust to drive your own initiatives.
Dynamic Work Environment: Based at the Merantix AI Campus, Berlin’s hub for AI innovation, you’ll work in a diverse, collaborative environment. With frequent events and opportunities for cross-company collaboration, you’ll be part of a thriving ecosystem of AI startups and experts.
Learning budget and quarterly hackathons: We truly believe in the importance of curiosity and experimentation as both a learning opportunity and strategic advantage. We therefore have a learning budget to explore new technologies and regular hackathons to prototype new ideas.


APPLICATION REQUIREMENT: Intro Video Submission

As Part Of Your Application To Briink, Please Submit a Short Intro Video (maximum Of 2 Minutes) Addressing The Following Points


Brief Introduction:
Introduce yourself and summarize your professional background relevant to this role
Passion for building AI/LLMs:
Share what excites you most about this role and why you think you'd be good at it
Alignment with Briink’s Mission:
Explain why you’re interested in joining Briink and how our mission resonates with you.
Technical Guidelines:


Duration: The video should not exceed 2 minutes.
Content Quality: We are not assessing video production skills; using a webcam or smartphone is perfectly fine. Focus on clear communication and authenticity.
Format: In the application form, please provide a link to your video hosted on a platform like YouTube (unlisted), Vimeo, Loom, or a shared drive OR upload the video file under "Other" in the Documents section.


Purpose of the Video:


This video helps us get to know you beyond your resume. We’re interested in your communication skills, your passion, and how you envision contributing to Briink’s mission and culture.
No cover letter is required!


About Us

At Briink, we are driven by a shared belief that sustainable finance is the key to addressing some of the world's most pressing problems, including climate change, economic inequality, and social injustice. Our B2B SaaS platform harnesses the power of AI to help companies across all industries make more sustainable decisions and access the trillions in capital being mobilized towards the climate transition.

We are a diverse and dynamic team that is passionate about making a positive impact on the world. We believe in trust and ownership, and strive to create a workplace culture that is inclusive, supportive, and empowering.
Show more
HTML:
What We Do

READ BEFORE APPLYING: Adding a short intro video is mandatory for this position. We do this to get a better sense of candidates before continuing the process. Any application without a video will be rejected by default. Find instructions at the bottom of the post. No cover letter is required. Thank you!

At Briink, we're helping accelerate the transition to a sustainable future by creating the next-generation of AI powered tools for sustainability advisory, audit, and certification teams.

We believe that AI is the key to unlocking the future of sustainable business. With over 50 enterprise clients—including some of the world's largest firms—we’re already transforming how organizations manage their ESG data. Our technology helps sustainability teams uncover actionable insights from unstructured data sources, making it easier to drive compliance, efficiency, and impact at scale.

Backed by €7 million in capital, including a freshly closed round, and supported by leading venture capital funds, Briink is at the forefront of ESG innovation. We’re based at the heart of Europe’s AI revolution—the AI Campus in Berlin—where we are building a future where AI helps accelerate the transition to a sustainable future.

Your role

As Briink’s AI/LLM Engineer, you will work as part of the product and engineering team to bring the cutting edge of LLMs to sustainable finance and help advance Briink’s mission to use AI to help accelerate transition to a sustainable economy. This includes both using your knowledge and experience as an AI practitioner to evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM engine, as well as explore new use-cases for LLMs in ESG and sustainability.

  • Systematically evaluate and improve our core LLM systems: You will use your knowledge and experience as an AI/LLM practitioner to systematically evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM system and help ensure Briink becomes a world leader for ESG domain specific LLM tools.
  • Build LLMs into production grade services: On a scale with pure researcher on one side and traditional backend software development on the other side, this leans somewhat more on the software engineering side of the scale, as part of your role will also be to help ensure that improvements to the AI/LLM services are driven through to production and delivering tangible value to our users.
  • Explore new LLM use-cases in ESG: Both LLMs are ESG are moving very fast and so at Briink we value curiosity and exploring AI could be applied to new use cases in ESG. Part of your role therefore will be to explore and prototype new ways LLMs could support our users and solve new problems for ESG teams.
  • Be a core member of the product and engineering team: Briink is a collaborative team and we really enjoy working together to try and build Briink into a successful company that has mission impact at scale. You will therefore work closely as part of a cross discipline team to make sure all the work we do pushes in the same direction an helps achieve our mission.

Your profile

Your Profile

  • Knowledgable and experienced with building AI/LLM products: You have strong knowledge and experience of thinking through and building AI/LLM systems successfully.
  • Practical Implementer: You are a ‘builder’ and aim to pragmatically integrate AI into real-world products, moving beyond research to create tangible, impactful solutions.
  • Personal agency and drive: must have personal agency, drive and ability to figure things out, learn and iterate.
  • Innovative Thinker: You're driven by curiosity and continually experiment with new technologies and techniques in the rapidly evolving AI/LLM space.
  • Excellent Communicator: You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English, and can build strong relationships with internal teams and external partners.
  • Collaborative and Organised: You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve success. Preferably with experience in start-ups.
  • Passion for ESG and Sustainability: You are motivated by using your skills to help address climate change and enthusiastic about building tools that help ESG and sustainability teams.

Skill Requirements

  • Minimum of 4 years of experience: As an AI Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, AI/ML Product Engineer or related roles.
  • Fluency in python: Including strong proficiency with base python as well as popular modern frameworks ****(e.g. fastAPI)
  • Experience with LLMs: Including core concepts around foundation models, prompt engineering and LLM chains, as well as preferably some experience with LLM frameworks (e.g. Langchain). Experience using LLMs to build RAG systems and/or other real-world use-cases related to document processing would be a major bonus.
  • Experience with LLM evaluation: Including how to collect labelled data and systematically evaluate RAG and other real world LLM applications, preferably with experience in evaluation tools and frameworks (e.g. Langsmith)
  • Experience with production grade applications: Including familiarity with software development tools and practices for production applications (e..g git, CI/CD, containerization) and preferably some experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment (e.g. GCP/AWS/Azure, Modal). Any experience with implications of deploying LLMs at scale would be a major bonus.
  • Fluency in English: With the ability to clearly communicate complex topics to diverse stakeholders.
  • Understanding or interest in sustainability: Including an interest in sustainability climate, or ESG topics and a desire to use your skills to help accelerate the climate transition.

Even if your experience doesn’t align precisely with all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. Many people miss out on opportunities because they feel they don’t fit every requirement—we believe in growth, not perfection!

What We Offer

  • Competitive Remuneration: As a core member of our team, you will receive a competitive salary and equity package, reflecting your role in shaping Briink’s future.
  • Purpose-Driven Mission: ESG data has the power to create a more sustainable world, but today it presents more challenges than solutions. We believe AI can change that. Be part of the transition to an AI-powered, sustainable world.
  • Flexible Working: Our work philosophy is built on flexibility. While we do like to come to the office (in Berlin or London) to collaborate in person, this is a hybrid role with opportunities for some remote work within European time zones.
  • Trust and Ownership: At Briink, we empower you to own your projects with the option for growing into new roles. We believe in giving people autonomy and trust to drive your own initiatives.
  • Dynamic Work Environment: Based at the Merantix AI Campus, Berlin’s hub for AI innovation, you’ll work in a diverse, collaborative environment. With frequent events and opportunities for cross-company collaboration, you’ll be part of a thriving ecosystem of AI startups and experts.
  • Learning budget and quarterly hackathons: We truly believe in the importance of curiosity and experimentation as both a learning opportunity and strategic advantage. We therefore have a learning budget to explore new technologies and regular hackathons to prototype new ideas.

APPLICATION REQUIREMENT: Intro Video Submission

As Part Of Your Application To Briink, Please Submit a Short Intro Video (maximum Of 2 Minutes) Addressing The Following Points

  • Brief Introduction:
    • Introduce yourself and summarize your professional background relevant to this role
  • Passion for building AI/LLMs:
    • Share what excites you most about this role and why you think you'd be good at it
  • Alignment with Briink’s Mission:
    • Explain why you’re interested in joining Briink and how our mission resonates with you.
Technical Guidelines:

  • Duration: The video should not exceed 2 minutes.
  • Content Quality: We are not assessing video production skills; using a webcam or smartphone is perfectly fine. Focus on clear communication and authenticity.
  • Format: In the application form, please provide a link to your video hosted on a platform like YouTube (unlisted), Vimeo, Loom, or a shared drive OR upload the video file under "Other" in the Documents section.

Purpose of the Video:

  • This video helps us get to know you beyond your resume. We’re interested in your communication skills, your passion, and how you envision contributing to Briink’s mission and culture.
  • No cover letter is required!

About Us

At Briink, we are driven by a shared belief that sustainable finance is the key to addressing some of the world's most pressing problems, including climate change, economic inequality, and social injustice. Our B2B SaaS platform harnesses the power of AI to help companies across all industries make more sustainable decisions and access the trillions in capital being mobilized towards the climate transition.

We are a diverse and dynamic team that is passionate about making a positive impact on the world. We believe in trust and ownership, and strive to create a workplace culture that is inclusive, supportive, and empowering.

Title: AI/LLM Engineer
Description:
What we do
READ BEFORE APPLYING: Adding a short intro video is mandatory for this position. We do this to get a better sense of candidates before continuing the process. Any application without a video will be rejected by default. Find instructions at the bottom of the post. No cover letter is required. Thank you!


At Briink, we're helping accelerate the transition to a sustainable future by creating the next-generation of AI powered tools for sustainability and ESG teams on the frontlines of solving the climate crisis.




We believe that AI is the key to unlocking the future of sustainable business. With over 50 enterprise clients—including some of the world's largest firms—we’re already transforming how organizations manage their ESG data. Our technology helps sustainability teams uncover actionable insights from unstructured data sources, making it easier to drive compliance, efficiency, and impact at scale.




Backed by €7 million in capital, including a freshly closed round, and supported by leading venture capital funds, Briink is at the forefront of ESG innovation. We’re based at the heart of Europe’s AI revolution—the AI Campus in Berlin—where we are building a future where AI helps accelerate the transition to a sustainable future.


Your role


As Briink’s AI/LLM Engineer, you will work as part of the product and engineering team to bring the cutting edge of LLMs to sustainable finance and help advance Briink’s mission to accelerate transition to a sustainable planet. This includes both using your knowledge and experience as an AI practitioner to evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM engine, as well as exploring new use-cases for LLMs in ESG and sustainability.





Systematically evaluate and improve our core LLM systems: You will use your knowledge and experience as an AI/LLM practitioner to systematically evaluate and improve our core ESG AI/LLM system and help ensure Briink becomes a world leader for ESG domain specific LLM tools.


Build LLMs into production grade services: On a scale with pure researcher on one side and traditional backend software development on the other side, this leans somewhat more on the software engineering side of the scale, as part of your role will also be to help ensure that improvements to the AI/LLM services are driven through to production and delivering tangible value to our users.


Explore new LLM use-cases in ESG: Both LLMs and ESG are moving very fast and so at Briink we value curiosity and exploring how AI could be applied to new use cases in ESG. Part of your role therefore will be to explore and prototype new ways LLMs could support our users and solve new problems for ESG teams.


Be a core member of the product and engineering team: Briink is a collaborative team and we really enjoy working together to try and build Briink into a successful company that has mission impact at scale. You will therefore work closely as part of a cross discipline team to make sure all the work we do pushes in the same direction and helps achieve our mission.



Your profile

What type of person we're looking for...



Knowledgable and experienced with building AI/LLM products: You have strong knowledge and experience of thinking through and building AI/LLM systems from prototyping and experiments through to deployment, evaluation, monitoring and improvement in production.


Practical Implementer: You are a ‘builder’ and aim to pragmatically integrate AI into real-world products, moving beyond research to create tangible, impactful solutions.


Personal agency and drive: must have personal agency, drive and ability to figure things out, learn and iterate to drive initiatives forward to success.


Innovative Thinker: You're driven by curiosity and continually experiment with new models, techniques and technologies in the rapidly evolving AI/LLM space.


Excellent Communicator: You have outstanding verbal and written communication skills in English, and can build strong relationships with internal teams and external partners.


Collaborative and Organised: You thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, managing multiple projects while collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams to achieve success. Preferably with experience in start-ups.


Passion for ESG and Sustainability: You are motivated by using your skills to help address climate change and enthusiastic about building tools that help ESG and sustainability teams.



Technical Skills



Minimum of 4 years of experience: As an AI Engineer, Machine Learning Engineer, AI/ML Product Engineer or related roles.


Fluency in python: Including strong proficiency with base python as well as modern frameworks (e.g. fastAPI)


Experience with LLMs: Including core concepts around foundation models, prompt engineering and chains etc. as well as preferably some experience with LLM frameworks (e.g. Langchain). Experience using LLMs to build RAG systems and/or other real-world use-cases related to document processing would be a major bonus.


Experience with LLM evaluation: Including how to collect labelled data and systematically evaluate RAG and other real world LLM applications, preferably with experience in evaluation tools and frameworks (e.g. Langsmith)


Experience with production grade applications: Including familiarity with software development tools and practices for production applications (e.g git, CI/CD, containerization) and preferably some experience with cloud infrastructure and deployment (e.g. GCP, Modal). Any experience with cost/latency implications of deploying LLMs at scale would be a major bonus.


Fluency in English: With the ability to clearly communicate complex topics to diverse stakeholders. Any other European language would be a bonus.


Understanding or interest in sustainability: Including an interest in sustainability climate, or ESG topics and a desire to use your skills to help accelerate the climate transition.
Even if your experience doesn’t align precisely with all the criteria, we encourage you to apply. Many people miss out on opportunities because they feel they don’t fit every requirement—we believe in growth, not perfection!



What we offer



Competitive Remuneration: As a core member of our team, you will receive a competitive salary and equity package, reflecting your role in shaping Briink’s future.


Purpose-Driven Mission: ESG data has the power to create a more sustainable world, but today it presents more challenges than solutions. We believe AI can change that. Be part of the transition to an AI-powered, sustainable world.


Flexible Working: Our work philosophy is built on flexibility. While we do like to come to the office (in Berlin or London) to collaborate in person, this is a hybrid role with opportunities for some remote work within European time zones.


Trust and Ownership: At Briink, we empower you to own your projects with the option for growing into new roles. We believe in giving people autonomy and trust to drive your own initiatives.


Dynamic Work Environment: Based at the Merantix AI Campus, Berlin’s hub for AI innovation, you’ll work in a diverse, collaborative environment. With frequent events and opportunities for cross-company collaboration, you’ll be part of a thriving ecosystem of AI startups and experts.


Learning budget and quarterly hackathons: We truly believe in the importance of curiosity and experimentation as both a learning opportunity and strategic advantage. We therefore have a learning budget to explore new technologies and regular hackathons to prototype new ideas.





APPLICATION REQUIREMENT: Intro Video Submission
As part of your application to Briink, please submit a short intro video (maximum of 2 minutes) addressing the following points:





Brief Introduction:



Introduce yourself and summarize your professional background relevant to this role






Passion for building AI/LLMs:



Share what excites you most about this role and why you think you'd be good at it






Alignment with Briink’s Mission:



Explain why you’re interested in joining Briink and how our mission resonates with you.
Technical Guidelines:










Duration: The video should not exceed 2 minutes.


Content Quality: We are not assessing video production skills; using a webcam or smartphone is perfectly fine. Focus on clear communication and authenticity.


Format: In the application form, please provide a link to your video hosted on a platform like YouTube (unlisted), Vimeo, Loom, or a shared drive OR upload the video file under "Other" in the Documents section.
Purpose of the Video:


This video helps us get to know you beyond your resume. We’re interested in your communication skills, your passion, and how you envision contributing to Briink’s mission and culture.


No cover letter is required!

Title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
Description:
Title: AI Engineer




Location : Remote in Germany (preferably Berlin)




Salary : 65k-100k +




Join Europe's Fastest-Growing EdTech Platform!

Are you passionate about AI and its transformative power in education we're reimagining education with AI.




Role Overview:

As an AI Engineer, you’ll take full ownership of developing and refining our AI product, working across both backend and AI systems. You’ll help us shape the future of personalized learning while working alongside a talented, high-growth team of engineers and product specialists.




Key Responsibilities:

Own the development of AI-powered tutors, focusing on improving metrics and user experience.
Work end-to-end: from AI discovery and product development to implementation and testing.
Collaborate closely with product, backend, and frontend teams to make a big impact.
Lead and innovate in AI development, driving continuous improvement in the product.




Must-Have Skills:

Strong understanding of AI (doesn’t need professional experience, but a solid grasp of the basics).
Experience building side projects or contributing to AI initiatives (academic projects count!).
Passion for AI and its potential impact on education.
A self-starter who thrives in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
Understanding of product development and how to impact business outcomes.




Nice-to-Have Skills:

Experience with full-stack development (able to contribute across backend and frontend).
Familiarity with product impact metrics: growth, retention, and monetization.




What We Offer:

Equity (ESOP) options to share in the company’s success.
Benefits: Urban Sports Club, team events, development budgets, and more!
Remote work: Hybrid model with a travel budget for team workations.

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Senior ML Engineer

Location: Berlin / Hybrid (2 days on-site)

Salary: €95k - €110k




WHO’S THIS WITH?




Very successful, respected and leading fashion and lifestyle on-line retailer, a Berlin success story in itself.
You will be joining as a senior engineering member in a team looking to integrate Machine Learning into what they are currently working across




WHAT’S THE ROLE?




Senior Machine Learning Engineer with expertise in image generation and computer vision
Being the lead in ML engineering to enable the building of future shaping content production tooling




WHAT DO I NEED TO BE GOOD AT?




Assessing various different solutions, tools or AI models
InnovatIng, consultanting, developing and making decisions on integrating the right AI solutions into the existing infrastructure
ETL pipelines, AWS Sagemaker, Bedrock and general ML/AI experience
Technical Leadership




WHAT SKILLS DO I NEED?




Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field
Strong software engineering skills with Python and ideally one other language like Kotlin or Java
3D representation, PyTorch, Keras, and TensorFlow




BENEFITS, PERKS, BONUSES




Wide range of benefits including large on-line discounts, shares programme, working abroad allowance, family, health and well-being services and many many more.
You will be joining a company where a vision of sustainability, diversity, inclusion and community is a continuing key part of the culture




Extra.

This is a hybrid role, based in Berlin (top location) with an expectance to ideally be on-site / in office for 2 days a week.

Title: Backend Engineer for Machine Learning
Description:
✨ About Us ✨

Photoroom was launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our mission is clear: to create the best visuals for your commerce.

Photoroom puts the power of great images into more people's hands through our powerful and innovative features, from our best-in-the-world background remover to our generative AI model and tools: AI Images, AI Backgrounds and Shadows, AI Expand, and many more.

Processing over 5 billion images a year and downloaded over 200 million times, Photoroom is now the world's #1 AI photo-editing app, available across mobile, web, and via an API in over 180 countries.

We are at an exciting stage of our journey. Having successfully raised our Series B, we aim at sustaining 40% YoY growth.

Photoroom is a profitable, remote-friendly company headquartered in Paris with a global team of over 80 world-class deep learning, product, and marketing experts with backgrounds at the world's best companies. We are a diverse team of entrepreneurs building for entrepreneurs.

TL;DR

🤓 We are looking for a FastAPI developer, expert in async Python to help us add new AI features in Photoroom. You will build and enhance AI features, improve private API speed, and integrate multiple services to deliver high-quality images to our users

💰 €70k to €90k* + Stock-Options/BSPCE

🇪🇺 Flexible location: you can work remotely from anywhere in Europe with monthly visits to Paris (fully reimbursed), or come to the office more often

✈️ If needed, relocation support (up to 10k€), including finding an apartment in Paris and supporting you with the visa procedure. Notice: We are currently unable to sponsor visas for remote positions outside of France.

🏖️ Socials - Biannual company retreats, monthly gatherings


We can go higher for outstanding profiles and adapt to the cost of living if it is higher than in Paris.


✨ About the role ✨


You’ll collaborate with the AI Tools squad implement and improve AI features in the Photoroom app (Logo maker, AI Images and other features available on the homepage of the app)
You’ll design and architect new features, chaining a mix of internal and external services to generate breathtaking images for our users
You’ll monitor and scale the growing load on the FastAPI service, leveraging Datadog to find optimizations and bottlenecks or implementing smart caching of pipeline steps


✨ About You ✨


You have experience designing and updating internal REST APIs, collaborating with other teams to gather their requirements and monitoring and improving the performance of existing services, ideally with Datadog.
You have work experience with FastAPI or a similar async Python http framework (has to be async).
You have experience with integration testing in a large Python project and wiring multiple external services or APIs together reliably
You have worked in a fast-paced startup in the past
Bonus: You have experience with image libraries in Python (Pillow, OpenCV)
Bonus: you have worked with Server Side Events


If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

🌈 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at the workplace. We believe both the company and its culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's why:


We have flexible working hours
We trust people to work remotely
We extended the length of the parental leave


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.


Show more
HTML:
✨ About Us ✨

Photoroom was launched in 2020 after being accepted into Y Combinator and has become the world's most popular AI photo editor over the past four years. Our mission is clear: to create the best visuals for your commerce.

Photoroom puts the power of great images into more people's hands through our powerful and innovative features, from our best-in-the-world background remover to our generative AI model and tools: AI Images, AI Backgrounds and Shadows, AI Expand, and many more.

Processing over 5 billion images a year and downloaded over 200 million times, Photoroom is now the world's #1 AI photo-editing app, available across mobile, web, and via an API in over 180 countries.

We are at an exciting stage of our journey. Having successfully raised our Series B, we aim at sustaining 40% YoY growth.

Photoroom is a profitable, remote-friendly company headquartered in Paris with a global team of over 80 world-class deep learning, product, and marketing experts with backgrounds at the world's best companies. We are a diverse team of entrepreneurs building for entrepreneurs.

TL;DR

🤓 We are looking for a FastAPI developer, expert in async Python to help us add new AI features in Photoroom. You will build and enhance AI features, improve private API speed, and integrate multiple services to deliver high-quality images to our users

💰 €70k to €90k* + Stock-Options/BSPCE

🇪🇺 Flexible location: you can work remotely from anywhere in Europe with monthly visits to Paris (fully reimbursed), or come to the office more often

✈️ If needed, relocation support (up to 10k€), including finding an apartment in Paris and supporting you with the visa procedure. Notice: We are currently unable to sponsor visas for remote positions outside of France.

🏖️ Socials - Biannual company retreats, monthly gatherings

  • We can go higher for outstanding profiles and adapt to the cost of living if it is higher than in Paris.

✨ About the role ✨

  • You’ll collaborate with the AI Tools squad implement and improve AI features in the Photoroom app (Logo maker, AI Images and other features available on the homepage of the app)
  • You’ll design and architect new features, chaining a mix of internal and external services to generate breathtaking images for our users
  • You’ll monitor and scale the growing load on the FastAPI service, leveraging Datadog to find optimizations and bottlenecks or implementing smart caching of pipeline steps

✨ About You ✨

  • You have experience designing and updating internal REST APIs, collaborating with other teams to gather their requirements and monitoring and improving the performance of existing services, ideally with Datadog.
  • You have work experience with FastAPI or a similar async Python http framework (has to be async).
  • You have experience with integration testing in a large Python project and wiring multiple external services or APIs together reliably
  • You have worked in a fast-paced startup in the past
  • Bonus: You have experience with image libraries in Python (Pillow, OpenCV)
  • Bonus: you have worked with Server Side Events

If you think you have what it takes but don't meet every single point above, please still apply. We'd love to chat and see if you could be a great fit.

🌈 Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging

We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued at the workplace. We believe both the company and its culture are strongest when composed of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

That's why:

  • We have flexible working hours
  • We trust people to work remotely
  • We extended the length of the parental leave

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.

Title: Staff Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high-quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That's where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Staff Data Scientist at Aignostics, you will play a crucial role in shaping the scientific and technical direction and integrity of our data science platform, projects, and products. You will work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art for digital pathology. Your expertise will be instrumental in driving scientific and technical excellence across all data science teams, ensuring we deliver high-quality, scalable solutions that transform complex biomedical data into actionable insights for cancer research and diagnostics. You will work within the Data Science Staff team.

This is a unique opportunity to join a fun, diverse, and growing team of 100+ machine learners, software engineers, applied scientists, pathologists, and biologists to shape the next generation of cancer treatments. You will be part of a driven community that works in an agile, supportive, and interdisciplinary research environment where your results make a difference to patients. In our established startup, you have the opportunity to grow personally and technically, take on significant responsibilities, and benefit from a dynamic work environment.

Data Science or Machine Learning? We do both at Aignostics, and are convinced that both are needed for success. You can expect to work on a broad spectrum of topics from deep learning with foundation and other state-of-the-art models on terabytes of data to projects in low sample regimes and very high-dimensional and multimodal data. We have nearly all the data science challenges you can think of for you!

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


You identify promising new directions based on the scientific literature, results from in-house experiments, and your own novel ideas.
You are able to turn these ideas into reality by describing, presenting, designing, implementing, and experimenting with novel machine learning architectures, models, and variants of existing models
You analyze experiments that you and others run, and form ideas and hypotheses to explain results
You run large-scale distributed machine learning experiments on a day to day basis
You work with the Staff Data Science team and with other Data Science teams involved in machine learning and translational research
You resolve technical difficulties that arise as part of the data science and machine learning work
You develop ideas about our data science and machine learning strategy, and how this relates to business objectives, so as to provide a competitive advantage
You develop ideas about product management on technical and scientific feasibility and risks of complex product features
You contribute to technical and scientific design, planning, and integration of our platform across systems and algorithms
You provide technical and scientific guidance in data science model, algorithm, and system design reviews
Educate mid-level and junior data scientists to bring them up to the next level
Demonstrate long-term thinking and utmost technical and scientific excellence in your individual contributions
Support data science teams in maintaining up-to-date, high-quality documentation and code


What We Are Looking For


Demonstrated research excellence, as demonstrated by your scientific track record: peer-reviewed publications in relevant journals and at relevant conferences
Proven track record of driving technical and scientific excellence and innovation
Expertise in: pathology machine learning, foundation models, and robust medical machine learning models
Deep understanding of what it means and takes to apply machine learning in the medical domain
Extensive knowledge and understanding of relevant deep learning models
Knowledge of the medical and/or biological domain is a highly valuable additional qualification
Excellent communicative skills, able to articulate complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
You are a team player who gets enthusiastic when your contributions drive the team ahead
Extensive experience with designing, setting up, running, monitoring and evaluating large scale distributed machine learning trainings; 6+ years of experience with this
Advanced degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Statistics, Physics, Mathematics, or a related field that provides sufficient technical background to perform state of the art machine learning research
Extensive experience with machine learning and statistical concepts, including advanced topics such as self-supervised learning, foundation models, representation learning, explainable AI (XAI), multimodal models
Knowledge and routine application of best practices in software engineering, software architecture, and clean coding
Solid understanding of cloud technologies (GCP, AWS), containerization and orchestration (Kubernetes, Ray)


Ideally, you also …


Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications
Have experience with large scale data processing systems such as Ray, Spark, etc.
Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare
Have knowledge of digital pathology or medical imaging
Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing, and you are encouraged to apply if you have a strong combination of these skills.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


About Us

  • Contribute to open-source projects and scientific publications

  • Extensive expertise in multiple programming languages and frameworks is a plus
  • Worked in a regulated environment, e.g. financial services, aerospace, or healthcare

  • Have experience with biomedical data processing and analysis

  • Join a purpose-driven startup: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
  • Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, LMU Munich, TU Berlin, and our other partners
  • Work with a welcoming, diverse, and highly international team of colleagues
  • Opportunity to take significant responsibility and grow your role within the startup
  • Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development yearly budget of 1,000€ (plus 2 L&D days), language classes and internal development programs
  • Mentoring program, where you'll learn from and mentor great experts
  • Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
  • Enjoy your well-deserved time off with 28 paid vacation days per year
  • We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
  • Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport, sports, and well-being
  • Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment

Title: Senior Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
Why us?

We believe that AI has the potential to revolutionize how cancer and other complex diseases are diagnosed and treated. We also believe that AI is a tool, not an identity – without access to high quality data and a scientifically rigorous, transparent approach to model development, AI is just a buzzword. That’s where we come in.

Aignostics is a spin-off from one of Europe's largest and most prestigious university hospitals (Charité), with employees in Berlin and New York. We have received over $50M in funding from leading investors and are a growing team of over 100 interdisciplinary professionals. We work with academic partners as well as leading global life sciences companies.

As a Senior Data Scientist at Aignostics, you work hand in hand with our collaborators in academia and industry to push the state of the art of machine learning for digital pathology. You translate biomedical challenges into concrete machine learning research roadmaps and coordinate their execution. Together with your colleagues you develop elegant solutions to complex problems, conduct rigorous experiments and finally convince your stakeholders with crystal clear presentations.

At Aignostics, we believe that fighting cancer is a job for people of all identities, backgrounds, and cultures. We value and celebrate diversity and inclusion and are committed to offering equal employment and promotion opportunities for all applicants and employees. Applicants will be considered regardless of their age, disability, ethnicity, race, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, etc. We thrive through collaboration and believe the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be.

Where your expertise is needed


Plan and execute interdisciplinary projects connecting machine learning, software engineering and biomedical domain knowledge
Research, pilot and evaluate novel computer vision approaches for extracting insight from high-resolution biological images
Transform proof-of-concept machine learning models into automated, tested and production-ready systems
Support and mentor junior colleagues
Clearly communicate your results in internal and external presentations


What We Are Looking For


Ph.D or MSc. in a relevant field, e.g. Computer Science, Machine Learning or Bioinformatics
Eagerness to lead initiatives, learn new technologies and excel in a complex space
Solid theoretical foundations and several years of experience developing novel machine learning techniques
Advanced skills in Python, Linux, cloud computing and machine learning software stacks
Passion for clean code and high standards for quality assurance
Ability to independently define, organize and complete research projects
Excellent communication and team working skills Bonus points for
Experience with development of deep learning models for computer vision
Exposure to biomedical data
Leadership experience in a research context


We are still keen to hear from you if you don't match all the above points! Our needs are diverse and growing and you are encouraged to apply if you have any combination of these skills. The recruitment process is a comparative exercise and decisions will be made based on the applications we review at each time.

Our offer


Join a purpose-driven start up: We are working collectively to fight cancer and improve patient outcomes. Come help us make a difference!
Cutting-edge AI research and development, with involvement of Charité, TU Berlin and our other partners
Work with a welcoming, diverse and highly international team of colleagues
Opportunity to take responsibility and grow your role within the startup
Expand your skills by benefitting from our Learning & Development budget, language classes and internal development programs
Mentoring program, you’ll learn from great experts
Flexible working hours and teleworking policy
Enjoy your well-deserved time off within our 28 paid vacations days per year
We are family & pet friendly and support flexible parental leave options
Pick a subsidized membership of your choice among public transport sports and well-being
Enjoy our social gatherings, lunches, and off-site events for a fun and inclusive work environment


Join us to make a difference!

Title: Data Scientist (d/f/m)
Description:
mobile.de is Germany's largest vehicle marketplace with about 1.4 million listed cars, trucks, and motorcycles. Both private customers and more than 40,000 registered vehicle dealers use the platform. Including listing exports to the sister platform Kleinanzeigen, mobile.de reaches about 20 million unique users per month (AGMA digital facts; mobile.de and Kleinanzeigen; categories: cars, motorcycles, commercial vehicles, motorhomes; Ø month April 2022 to March 2023). As a "one-stop shop," mobile.de offers not only buying and selling services but also financing and leasing solutions, among others. The company, founded in 1996, is a subsidiary of Adevinta, a globally leading provider of online classifieds portals.

mobile.de is part of Adevinta: a global online classifieds specialist and sustainability leader with 25+ products in 10 countries.

About The Team

What you’ll do & Who you are

We are looking for a Data Scientist (d/f/m) to join our central data science team in Berlin, focusing on Search and Ranking tools.

You will report to the Head of Data Science, collaborate with all data scientists across the company and work closely with the search product team, whose mission is to create a holistic and seamless search experience for our users.

We offer a flexible working environment, with the expectation of in-person office presence once/twice a week (or as required for product team appointments).

What You'll Do

As a Data Scientist, you will personalize and improve the search experience across our platforms. Your main responsibilities include:


Machine Learning Development: Design and deploy models to optimize search and ranking for a seamless user experience.
Data Insights: Analyze large datasets to identify patterns and create actionable solutions for business challenges.
Proof-of-Concepts: Build and validate POCs for innovative features and present their value to stakeholders.
Cross-functional collaboration: Work with product managers, UX designers, and engineers to align on search goals.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and refine search algorithms for scalability and efficiency.


Who You Are


3+ years of experience working with ML: Proficiency in designing, training, and deploying machine learning models, particularly for search, ranking, and recommendation systems.
Programming Skills: Advanced experience with Python (preferred) or R, along with expertise in SQL and NoSQL databases for data processing and analysis.
Cloud Platform Experience: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS or GCP, including deploying and managing machine learning solutions in production.
Data Science Toolkit Mastery: Solid knowledge of frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn.
Analytical Thinking: Strong ability to translate complex business challenges into data science problems and develop impactful solutions.
Collaboration and Communication: Ability to clearly explain technical concepts and complex insights to non-technical stakeholders, ensuring alignment and understanding.
Agile Mindset: Experience working in agile environments (e.g., Scrum or Kanban) and contributing to iterative product development processes.


Benefits

Life at Adevinta comes with its perks! Our Adevintans enjoy the following benefits:


An attractive Base Salary 💸
Participation in our Short Term Incentive plan (annual bonus) 🏆
Work From Anywhere: Enjoy up to 20 days a year of working from anywhere! Maybe not from the moon🌛well why not! just make sure you have internet connection! 🌍
A 24/7 Employee Assistance Program for you and your family, because we care ❤️
Win together, lose together is one of our key behaviours. At Adevinta you will find a collaborative environment with an opportunity to explore your potential and grow 🌱


On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

On top of these, we also provide a range of locally relevant benefits. Wanna know more? Apply and ask our recruiters! ✨

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you don’t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they don’t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Title: Data Scientist / Engineer
Description:
Are you passionate about AI, data science, and building impactful solutions? Our client is an innovative AI startup based in Berlin, driving corporate sustainability forward. By leveraging AI, they help mid size companies streamline their ESG reporting, optimising processes and reducing costs. Using AI and machine learning, they collect relevant data to generate ESG reports more efficiently. Following a successful funding round and the release of their second version, they are now expanding their team and hiring a Data Scientist / Engineer, with plans for further growth in 2025.




What to expect:

You will lead the development of AI pipelines, focusing on RAG and LLMs. Your work will involve designing data pipelines, fine-tuning models, and ensuring real-time data feedback loops for improved accuracy. You will collaborate closely with the team to define AI-driven features that enhance the platform’s capabilities. This role is ideal for someone eager to work in a dynamic startup environment and make a real impact.




Requirements:

2+ years experience in Data Science, Data Engineering, Software Engineering
Experienced in LLMs and RAG models
Expertise in data collection, processing, and pipeline development
Proficient in Python for AI and machine learning applications
Experience in AI observability, evaluation metrics and Azure AI is a plus




Perks:

Flexible work
Equity
Real Impact
Collaborative Working
Show more

Title: Python Developer
Description:
A company just West of Berlin are seeking a dedicated Senior Python Developer to join their dynamic team.




As a Senior developer, you will guide the cross-functional team, ensuring an agile working style and the adoption of best practices.




You will develop and implement a range of software solutions, contributing to the continuous improvement and stability of their platform using a tech stack that includes Python and TypeScript or React.




Responsibilities

Promote continuous improvement and high-quality software delivery, including effective impediment management.
Develop and maintain key components of our platform, ensuring continuous improvements and operational stability in the user space.
Use Python and/or TypeScript & React to develop robust applications.




Your Profile

A bachelor's degree (higher degrees preferred) in STEM, engineering, or a related field.
Experience as a software developer (3+ years).
Strong understanding of agile principles, values, and practices.
Proficiency in their tech stack, particularly Python and/or TypeScript and their ecosystems.
Proficiency in German (C1 level) is required; English (C1 level) is an advantage.




Why Join this company?

Exciting and diverse tasks with close collaboration in small teams.
A flat hierarchy with open communication channels and direct access to leadership.
Flexible working hours and the option to work from home.
Competitive salary and dedicated time for continuous improvement.




Join this scaling tech company who specialize in artificial intelligence, and programming, to work on innovative solutions in mobility, energy, and AI, and to be part of a team that values self-organization, creativity, and a fun, challenging work environment.




Please apply or send your CV to j.oniah@annapurnarecruitment.com.

Show more

Title: (Senior) Data Scientist (m/f/d)
Description:
We are looking for support as an

(Senior) Data Scientist (m/f/d)

(unlimited, full-time) Join our team at our location in Berlin, Verl and Oslo – flexible working conditions available

Are you enthusiastic about language-oriented generative AI and natural language processing and would you like to help shape a modern ML architecture? In our 9-person Data Science Processes & Digitization team, we develop intelligent decision-making logic for a wide range of business areas in our financial services portfolio by integrating AI and ML pipelines into our productive processes. To support our Customer Care, we take care of all communication channels – from emails, letters up to our call center.

These exciting tasks await you:


You create models based on communication data for classifying content, extracting details and clustering to optimize our services and communication processes
You will be involved in the conception from the idea to prototypes to production maturity - in a cross-functional team with our technical and architectural experts.
You use a wide variety of current tools and methods from ML frameworks, especially from the RAG, LLM, NLP area, and work on modern technology stacks from Azure and databricks to Docker and Kubernetes
You develop complex data flows with structured and unstructured data in the hybrid cloud environment
Be part of the large Bertelsmann AI & Analytics community and exchange ideas with your colleagues about current trends and challenges



What you bring to the table:


You are enthusiastic about approaching language analytically and applying the latest AI services and NLP methods profitably
You have a degree in a technical or quantitative field, e.g. computer science, computational linguistics, data science or another relevant field with a technical/quantitative focus
You have at least 1-2 years of relevant professional experience
You are proficient in the Python programming language
You have knowledge of the machine learning environment, background knowledge of language models and ideally already have some practical experience with Gen AI or RAG technologies
You enjoy working with data, are happy to learn new things and appreciate working in a team
Very good German language skills are an advantage, as we have many application contexts in German-speaking countries Very good English skills are important so that you can communicate well in our international team



#EUR26

Benefits:


At Riverty, you can be who you are. We are committed to creating an inclusive environment and a culture of appreciation, enriched by our employee networks.
Prioritize your health with supported sports and leisure activities.
Take advantage of our numerous training and development opportunities! Enhance your skills with training offered by the Bertelsmann University, language courses, or leadership training.
Benefit from our discounts on Bertelsmann products and financial incentives.
With our diverse work models, you can tailor your work to your preferences. Take advantage of mobile office, flexible working hours, and part-time models.
Show more

Title: React Native Entwickler (m/w/d)
Description:
About

Das Unternehmen

Die Heizung spinnt? Die Klingel ist kaputt? Das Licht bleibt aus? Nichts ist ärgerlicher als eine notwendige Reparatur in der eigenen Wohnung. B&O Service bringt das in Ordnung. Und das rund um die Uhr. Wir sind spezialisiert auf die Instandhaltung und Wohnungsmodernisierung und sind damit einer der wichtigsten Player in der Wohnungswirtschaft und Marktführer für Handwerksleistungen. Als Komplettanbieter übernehmen wir alle technischen Dienstleistungen von der Instandhaltung von Mietwohnungen über die Wohnungsmodernisierung und Wartung bis zur Beseitigung von Versicherungsschäden. Derzeit verantworten wir diese Leistungen in über 600.000 Wohnungen für privatwirtschaftliche und kommunale Wohnungsunternehmen deutschlandweit und beheben damit 1 Million Schäden pro Jahr. Diese hohe Zahl an Aufträgen lässt sich nur bewältigen, weil wir neben den 1.000 eigenen Handwerkenden mit knapp 1.000 ausgewählten Handwerksunternehmen zusammenarbeiten. Ein Profi-Netzwerk, das aufgrund des kontinuierlichen Wachstums ständig weiter ausgebaut wird.

Wir bei B&O wollen mit smarten digitalen Lösungen dazu beitragen, Ressourcen möglichst verantwortungsvoll zu nutzen und die technologische Entwicklung und Digitalisierung in der Industrie voranzutreiben.

Hierfür sind wir auf der Suche nach einem erfahrenen

React Native Entwickler (m/w/d)

in einem hybriden Arbeitsmodell für unseren Standort in Berlin.

Was Dich Erwartet

Du konzipierst und entwickelst unsere mobilen Applikationen mit React Native

Du treibst mit uns das Roll-out bestehender Android-Apps auf iOS voran

Du übernimmst die Themen Performance-Optimierung und Debugging für eine optimale Nutzererfahrung

Du stellst eine hohe Codequalität durch Tests, Code-Reviews und Dokumentationen sicher

Du feilst an der Entwicklung und Implementierung neuer Features auf Grundlage von Nutzer- und Marktanforderungen

Du arbeitest in agilen Teams zur kontinuierlichen Verbesserung unserer Produkte

Womit Du Uns Begeisterst

Du hast ein abgeschlossenes Studium der Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik oder eine vergleichbare Qualifikation oder verfügst über entsprechende Berufserfahrung

Du verfügst über sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Entwicklung mobiler Applikationen mit React Native, idealerweise bringst du bereits Erfahrungen mit nativer Entwicklung in Swift, Objective-C, Java oder Kotlin mit

Du besitzt erste Erfahrungen in der Entwicklung von mobilen Applikationen für iOS

Du kennst dich mit der Integration von APIs und Drittanbieter-Services aus

Du bist geübt im Umgang mit Tools wie Git, CI/CD-Pipelines und Test-Frameworks für React Native

Du arbeitest selbstständig und strukturiert und verfügst über eine hohe Problemlösungskompetenz

Was du von uns erwarten darfst

Sicherheit: Eine unbefristete Einstellung in einem krisensicheren Umfeld sowie eine pünktliche Gehaltszahlung sind für uns selbstverständlich.

Erholung: Bei uns erhältst du 30 Tage Erholungsurlaub und Urlaubsgeld. Für besondere Anlässe bekommst du zusätzliche freie Tage.

Wohlfühlen: Mit unserer digitalen und mobilen Zeiterfassung profitierst du von maximaler Freiheit für eine gute Work-Life-Balance. Hol dir deinen täglichen Ausgleich mit einem JobRad – oder nutze unsere Kooperation mit Urban Sports Club und EGYM WELLPASS.

Kindergartenzuschuss: Die Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf ist uns wichtig. Deswegen unterstützen wir dich monatlich mit einem steuerfreien Betrag in Höhe von 100,00 Euro für Kinderbetreuungseinrichtungen wie Kindertagesstätten oder Kindergärten.

Weiterentwicklung: Mit einem auf dich zugeschnittenen Entwicklungsplan und regelmäßigen Feedbackgesprächen kannst du dich persönlich und fachlich vollkommen entfalten.

Ein besonderes Hotelerlebnis: Erlebe einmal im Jahr zusammen mit deiner Familie unsere besonderen Angebote im B&O Parkhotel in Bad Aibling.

Haben wir dein Interesse geweckt? Dann lass uns gerne deinen Lebenslauf über unser Online-Formular zukommen. Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen!

B&O Service Berlin GmbH

Ansprechpartner: Jens Brennenstuhl

Tel.: +49 806 14 95 04 02

E-Mail: bewerbung@boservice.de

Bewerberhotline: 0800 49 500 60

WhatsApp: +49 151 55 07 07 07

www.bo-gruppe.de

Nice-to-have skills


React Native
Swift
Objective-C
Java
Kotlin
API Integration
Git
Berlin, Berlin, Germany


Work experience


Mobile
Mobile Engineering


Languages


German

Title: AI Training Specialist
Description:
Outlier helps the world’s most innovative companies improve their AI models by providing human feedback. Are you an experienced software engineer who would like to lend your coding expertise to train AI models?

We partner with organizations to train AI large language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. There is no requirement for previous AI experience.

You must write German for this specific AI training opportunity

About The Opportunity


Outlier is looking for talented coders that also speak German to help train generative artificial intelligence models
This freelance opportunity is remote and hours are flexible, so you can work whenever is best for you


You may contribute your expertise by…


Crafting and answering questions related to computer science in order to help train AI models
Evaluating and ranking code generated by AI models


Examples Of Desirable Expertise


Ability to articulate complex concepts fluently in German (required)
Currently enrolled in or completed a bachelor's degree or higher in computer science at a selective institution
Proficiency working with one or more of the the following languages: Java, Python, JavaScript / TypeScript, C++, Swift, and Verilog
Excellent attention to detail, including grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines


Payment


Currently, pay rates for core project work by coding experts range from USD $25 to $50 per hour.
Rates vary based on expertise, skills assessment, location, project need, and other factors. For example, higher rates may be offered to PhDs. For non-core work, such as during initial project onboarding or project overtime phases, lower rates may apply. Certain projects offer incentive payments. Please review the payment terms for each project.


PLEASE NOTE: We collect, retain and use personal data for our professional business purposes, including notifying you of opportunities that may be of interest and sharing with our affiliates. We limit the personal data we collect to that which we believe is appropriate and necessary to manage applicants’ needs, provide our services, and comply with applicable laws. Any information we collect in connection with your application will be treated in accordance with the Outlier Privacy Policy and our internal policies and programs designed to protect personal data.

This is a 1099 contract opportunity on the Outlier.ai platform. Because this is a freelance opportunity, we do not offer internships, sponsorship, or employment. You must be authorized to work in your country of residence. If you are an international student, you may be able to sign up for Outlier if you are on a visa. You should contact your tax and/or immigration advisor with specific questions regarding your circumstances.
Show more

Title: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT ENGINEER
Description:
BE A PART OF OUR R&D TEAM IN THE HEART OF TECHNOLOGY CENTER




We are looking for young and innovative Software & Hardware
Engineers in Berlin Germany to work with our R&D team to advance our products and solutions for machine vision, robotics, autonomous systems and industrial automation applications.


Tasks


Responsibilities




• Design, control, and implement advanced systems and products for automation and robotic applications




• Develop manufacturing processes according to global engineering standards




• Collaborate with other R&D engineers and technicians to design and to implement




• Summarize data and report on research, development and test results




• Examine requirements in product development projects




• Monitor maintenance and inspection plans




• Develop product designs for embedded systems and automation applications


Requirements


Requirements




• Engineering Degree (Computer Science or Mechanical or Electrical or Physics)




• Architecture design (Software or Mechanical or Electrical) skills




• Proven expertise as a Research and Development engineer




• Hands-on experience using design and calculation software




• Good knowledge of physics in mechanical and electrical applications




• Understanding of mechanical and electrical engineering for product standards




• Good knowledge in Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering fields is a plus.




• Advanced problem-solving abilities




• Attention to detail




• Strong organizational and communication skills




To apply, please send your application including CV, certificates and degrees.




#productdesign #robotics #inspection #3d #machinevision #AI
#machinelearning #automation #datascience #imageprocessing
#computervision #cobots

Title: Python Developer (m/w/d)
Description:
Your mission


Als Python Backend Developer (m/w/d) bei SIDES sind Sie verantwortlich für das Design, die Implementierung und die Wartung von Backend-Systemen und APIs mit Python. Ihre Expertise in FastAPI und SQLAlchemy wird entscheidend sein, um skalierbare und leistungsstarke Anwendungen zu entwickeln, die ein nahtloses Benutzererlebnis bieten. Sie werden eng mit unseren Frontend Entwicklern, Data Scientists und anderen Teammitgliedern zusammenarbeiten, um robuste und effiziente Lösungen bereitzustellen!


Hauptaufgaben:



Design, Entwicklung und Wartung von Backend-Diensten und APIs mit Python


Zusammenarbeit mit Frontend-Entwicklern zur Integration von Benutzeroberflächenelementen mit serverseitiger Logik


Sicherstellung der Leistung, Qualität und Reaktionsfähigkeit der Anwendungen


Implementierung von Sicherheits- und Datenschutzprotokollen


Schreiben von sauberem, wartbarem und gut dokumentiertem Code


Durchführung von Code-Reviews und konstruktives Feedback an Teammitglieder


Fehlerbehebung und Debugging von Anwendungen zur Sicherstellung optimaler Leistung


Auf dem neuesten Stand der Branchentrends, Technologien und Best Practices bleiben


Teilnahme an agilen Entwicklungsprozessen, einschließlich Sprint-Planung, Daily Stand-ups und Retrospektiven



Your profile
Erforderliche Fähigkeiten und Qualifikationen:



Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einem verwandten Bereich oder gleichwertige Berufserfahrung


Nachgewiesene Erfahrung als Python-Entwickler, insbesondere in der Backend-Entwicklung (5+ Jahre)


Starke Kenntnisse der Programmiersprache Python.Erfahrung mit Datenbanken (z.B. PostgreSQL, MySQL, REDIS, DynamoB)


Vertrautheit mit RESTful APIs und Webservices


Verständnis für asynchrone Programmierung und ereignisgesteuerte Architektur


Kenntnisse in Containerisierung und Bereitstellung mit Docker


Erfahrung mit Versionskontrollsystemen, insbesondere Git


Ausgeprägte Problemlösungsfähigkeiten sowie die Fähigkeit, sowohl eigenständig als auch im Team zu arbeiten


Hervorragende Kommunikations- und Kollaborationsfähigkeiten


Deutschkenntnisse sind von Vorteil, um effektiv mit unserem deutschsprachigen Team und unseren Kunden zu kommunizieren



Bevorzugte Fähigkeiten:



Erfahrung mit Cloud-Plattformen wie AWS, Azure oder Google Cloud


Erfahrung mit FastAPI, SQLAlchemy und ORM


Vertrautheit mit CI/CD-Pipelines und Tools wie Jenkins, Travis CI oder GitLab CI


Kenntnisse in Frontend-Technologien wie JavaScript, HTML und CSS


Erfahrung mit dem Schreiben von Unit-Tests


Erfahrung mit JIRA


Vertrautheit mit Microservices-Architektur und serverlosem Computing



Perks & Benefits
Was du von uns erwarten kannst:



A recipe for success: Wir sind dieses Jahr 10 Jahre alt geworden und sind als Spezialisten in der Gastronomie/Lieferindustrie bekannt. Mit SIDES repräsentierst du einen führenden Akteur auf diesem Gebiet.


Add ownership: Wir bieten dir die Möglichkeit, dein Talent und deine Ideen zu formen. Du hast Freiheit und Verantwortung in deiner täglichen Arbeit innerhalb deines Teams.


High-quality work equipment: Du erhältst erstklassige Ausrüstung, um deine Arbeit erfolgreich auszuführen. Im Büro erwarten dich moderne Geräte und ausreichend Platz für angenehme Interaktionen mit dem SIDES-Team.


Hungry for growth: Persönliches Wachstum und kontinuierliches Lernen haben bei uns oberste Priorität. Wir führen regelmäßige Feedback-Zyklen durch, bieten dir Möglichkeiten zur Teilnahme an Seminaren, Workshops und Kongressen.


Perks:



Firmenrabatte (CorporateBenefits), Zugang zu mehreren Mitarbeiterrabatten


Rabatt auf eine Fitnessstudio-Mitgliedschaft


E-Learning-Möglichkeiten


Mental Health-App-Einrichtung: InstaHelp


Snacks und Getränke im Büro






Baking a positive workplace: Dich erwartet ein fantastisches, perfekt vernetztes Büro im Herzen von Berlin (Schöneberg).
Klingt genau nach dem, was du gesucht hast? Dann freuen wir uns auf Deine aussagekräftige Bewerbung inklusive Gehaltsvorstellung und frühestem Eintrittstermin.
Show more
HTML:
Your mission

Als Python Backend Developer (m/w/d) bei SIDES sind Sie verantwortlich für das Design, die Implementierung und die Wartung von Backend-Systemen und APIs mit Python. Ihre Expertise in FastAPI und SQLAlchemy wird entscheidend sein, um skalierbare und leistungsstarke Anwendungen zu entwickeln, die ein nahtloses Benutzererlebnis bieten. Sie werden eng mit unseren Frontend Entwicklern, Data Scientists und anderen Teammitgliedern zusammenarbeiten, um robuste und effiziente Lösungen bereitzustellen!


Hauptaufgaben:

  • Design, Entwicklung und Wartung von Backend-Diensten und APIs mit Python

  • Zusammenarbeit mit Frontend-Entwicklern zur Integration von Benutzeroberflächenelementen mit serverseitiger Logik

  • Sicherstellung der Leistung, Qualität und Reaktionsfähigkeit der Anwendungen

  • Implementierung von Sicherheits- und Datenschutzprotokollen

  • Schreiben von sauberem, wartbarem und gut dokumentiertem Code

  • Durchführung von Code-Reviews und konstruktives Feedback an Teammitglieder

  • Fehlerbehebung und Debugging von Anwendungen zur Sicherstellung optimaler Leistung

  • Auf dem neuesten Stand der Branchentrends, Technologien und Best Practices bleiben

  • Teilnahme an agilen Entwicklungsprozessen, einschließlich Sprint-Planung, Daily Stand-ups und Retrospektiven

  • Vertrautheit mit RESTful APIs und Webservices

  • Verständnis für asynchrone Programmierung und ereignisgesteuerte Architektur

  • Kenntnisse in Containerisierung und Bereitstellung mit Docker

  • Erfahrung mit Versionskontrollsystemen, insbesondere Git
